1.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, containing, i.e. a tube; also a bed or valley of astream; also a strong thing or a hero
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

2.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

3.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

4.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, a thicket of men, i.e. a crowd
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth
properly, to move in acircle, i.e. (specifically) to march in asacred procession, to observe afestival; by implication, to be giddy

5.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to sink or depress (reflexive or causative)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

6.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to sink or depress (reflexive or causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Jarden, the principal river of Palestine
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

7.brief: an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
near, with or among; often in general, to
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

9.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)

10.brief: a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
